file_content.text: [You activate the communications device, but receive no response.]
Excellent work. I am in your debt. The marked cells have been released. Soon Xenovirus Prime will overrun the Republic.
I haven't received any signals from the cells. I can't release Xenovirus Prime until all the cells are marked.
[You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Imperial frequency.]
Hmm. I thought this communications device was shut down. Does that mean someone's finally managed to breach the prison's high-security areas?
Doctor Fizz Galko here. Bioengineer. I was nearly finished with my greatest experiment, Xenovirus Prime, when my team and I were forced to flee.
You have no idea how relieved I am that you're there. Finally, Xenovirus Prime will be released into the world.
"Xenovirus Prime"?
My most magnificent creation.
How will that work?
With your help, I hope.
You assume too much.
Then you must not be familiar with Xenovirus Prime.
With this virus, we can weaken the ranks of the Republic without ever firing a shot. It can be carried by anyone, but it only affects certain Republic-aligned species.
The known effects are vomiting, internal bleeding and eventually, death. It's magnificent.
Before we fled, I gave the virus to some of Belsavis's most dangerous prisoners. They are the vectors, the carriers. Free them, and they will infect the Republic for us.
Sounds delightful.
Good. Take the sensor device I left and use it to detect the infected aliens. Mark their cells. I will open them remotely once you're clear. Good luck.
This virus is aimed at aliens. Will it kill me?
What if I get infected?
I'm not sure it's wise to be freeing Belsavis's most dangerous prisoners.
Free them? Sounds reckless.
I should clarify.
All you need to do is use the sensor device I left and detect which aliens are infected, then mark their cages. I will open them remotely after you're clear.
There's no danger of being infected or attacked by the creatures. Though, who knows what other dangers are loose.
I guess I can do that.
You'd better be right.
You won't regret it. This project means everything to the Empire. They may reward all of us.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
That's awful. [Refuse quest]
I know it's not the most palatable thing, but we have to do what we have to do to win.
[This monitoring station appears to be deactivated.]
[You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Imperial frequency.]
